intro: Clematis bahamica, commonly known as the Bahamian clematis, is a flowering vine native to the Caribbean region. It produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, hairy hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
